channel.title: Blogs on J A C K
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on J A C K

item.title: Shipping as a habit
item.description: I’ve worked on a lot of projects (3d printing, grooming habits, video calling), but don’t publish enough. I don’t do the last 5%, I don’t risk it for the biscuit, and I don’t get enough feedback.

item.title: War for Rayuba - Deeushan
item.description: The world was still, and then there were screams. A huge creature emerged from the rubble. Joints aching for the first time in many turns, Deeushan patted himself down and walked through the colored scraps, shattered bottles, and dripping pipes.

item.title: War for Rayuba - Searching the Exalted Plains
item.description: Small skirmishes pepper the grassy plains near Team Bastion's home base. A lone sniper looks out. A polite and well dressed diversion, but Deeushan's search continues.

item.title: San Francisco Whiplash (gallery)
item.description: Birds Cars Infrastructure Moving Pride Signs Recreation Coast Work

item.title: The Bike Kitchen serves a 5 course meal - building a bike from parts
item.description: The San Francisco Bike Kitchen is where you find mechanical magic. This local non-profit, run by volunteers, offers a build-a-bike program for $40. This lets you build a bike with the used parts lying around the Kitchen.

item.title: The Most Foldable Ukulele in the World
item.description: A few years ago, I started playing guitar at university and wanted to keep going when I moved around. My solution was to invest in a foldable Voyage Air guitar.

item.title: The Adler Special Typewriter
item.description: A gift that the previous owners of my home left. I didn’t think much of it until I watched the documentary California Typewriter on a flight!

item.title: Packing less is good for my soul
item.description: For the past 5 years, I’ve moved every 4 months. It’s taken time, but I’ve changed from a hoarder (the way of my people) to someone who wants very little.

item.title: DIY camera finger strap to travel real light
item.description: I just bought a used Fujifilm X70 in an attempt to save on space and weight. To keep chasing that goal, I made another change. Neck strap -> wrist strap -> finger strap.

item.title: Exercise 9
item.description: Farah’s original work: https://minddrewablank.wordpress.com/2017/07/04/moving-still/ Herd is an image constructed from video sourced from Planet Earth. It compresses an overhead shot of a herd of animals into a single frame, creating a textured blur with sporadic details.

item.title: Exercise 8
item.description: Deep remixability When previously separate mediums are being combined in various ways - not just by format, but by technique, culture, and other meta-characteristics as well.

item.title: The Mental Game - statement
item.description: The Mental Game reflects a moment of tension that everyone has experienced before. As a child, maybe it’s jumping down more steps than you’ve ever tried.

item.title: Comic layouts in the digital age?
Taking pictures of moving things is hard
item.description:
She’ll never fall! --
Float --

item.title: Exercise 6
item.description: Constructed Narrative When the contents of a photograph have been artificially created by the artist in some way to reflect a narrative, rather than simply photographing a real scene.

item.title: A digital perspective - literally mixing media
item.description: Camera and Microphone Photos partially mixed with the audio recordings of the same moment, both kept in raw data formats.

item.title: A digital perspective - statement
item.description: Camera and Mic highlights the relationship between digital media and our physical senses. The piece prompts the viewer to recognize a pattern among 3 images.

item.title: Exercise 5
item.description: How obvious do you want it bro? Composited with selection, levels, shadows, spot healing, and manual drawing. Originals: --

item.title: Exercise 4
item.description: A world with people: And a world without: ### Indexical A characteristic of images that implies a mapping to the original real world subject.

item.title: Building a Processing Pipeline - final architecture
item.description: part 2 Configuration, security, and deployment with SQS were all as easy as expected, and IAM has been a great convenience. It was also pretty straight forward to write tasks for Celery - but successes are not interesting.

item.title: Extra glitches
item.description: An attempt to databend a .CR2 file (A-Law in Audacity). This kind of result seems to happen fairly consistently. Other attempts found on the internet seem to confirm this.

item.title: Browser Game - SunShower
item.description: Play it! Github Pet project based on an idea I had for a simple, challenging game with a high skill ceiling. It’s basically Tetris 360.

item.title: Cans Cans Cans - glitch experimentation
item.description: Source image is a picture of Campbell’s Soup Cans, by Andy Warhol, found here: https://www.timeout.com/newyork/art/andy-warhol-campbells-soup-cans-and-other-works-19531967. Displayed images have all been converted to JPG for presentation.

item.title: Exercise 3
item.description: A Pure Glitch is an effect either produced without intention or without understanding the underlying cause and system. A Glitch-alike is an effect produced purposefully and with some form of reasoning about how the effect was created.

item.title: Playing with gifs - statement
item.description: Making Waves is a short story about a boat in the small fishing town of Lamu, Kenya. Fishing has always been a mainstay in Lamu, but never the focus.

item.title: The small fishing town of Lamu
item.description: Making Waves

item.title: Exercise 2
item.description: Stereography A technique to generate a sense of depth in a visualization by presenting a different image to each eye. Mimics the way humans naturally perceive depth in every day life.

item.title: Cinemagraphs of an old African beach
item.description: I’ve wanted to make a cinemagraph since I first saw one on Reddit. The stars aligned: when I visited Lamu, I actually remembered. Keeping this in mind, I took a bunch of pictures in continuous shooting.

item.title: Exercise 1
item.description: Subjectivity An object that can be evaluated or interpreted differently by different subjects observing it. An example is the series of portraits done by Guim Ti√≥, where black and white portraits receive strokes of colored paint.

item.title: Why art
item.description: It was one of my favorite subjects, and I even did extra classes. But these were technical sessions and offered very little creative flexibility; I quit often.

item.title: Building a Processing Pipeline - Amazon AWS SQS vs RabbitMQ benchmarks
item.description: part 1 Our data pipeline needs a message broker for a Celery job queue; RabbitMQ and Amazon SQS are two good choices. They are designed to scale, guarantee message delivery, and seem to have good support.

item.title: Processing Pipeline - Requirements and architecture
item.description: At my work, we’re building a pipeline to provide data-driven feedback to users. The de-facto king for data is Python, thanks to its community. A common way to deploy these models is via a Flask application, but this isn’t a good fit for every case.

item.title: Sunshine for 3 winters in a row
item.description: I have a great view of the grey tarmac and overcast sky from my seat on the turboprop. Taking off, above the clouds, it’s a hot, sunny day.

item.title: It's hard to get used to losing things
item.description: Those of us that don’t pay attention to history are doomed to repeat it. 1 year ago: I’m on exchange, and life is fun. We travel as if we could actually afford it.

item.title: Alexa Skill - Daily Wiki
item.description: Amazon Github Yes I did it for the free Alexa dev sweater. No I haven’t retrieved my sweater yet. The ratings are pretty bad. People want the entire featured article read out to them.

item.title: Neural Net Powered Chrome Ext. - Page Predictor
item.description: Github A chrome extension that predicts what website you’re going to — so you don’t even have to type it in! Our team’s base assumption is that we visit some websites in certain patterns, and a neural net might be able to pick up on them.

item.title: Social Web App - Pattio (WIP)
item.description: On social media, we don’t communicate the way we do in real life. There are different protocols and habits, which can make interactions feel shallow or distracting.

item.title: Culture shock is real if you take yourself far enough
item.description: Now I know a little more about making jumps and taking hard landings. “It’s definitely overwhelming” — assurances come from many of the people I meet.

item.title: RTFM - software engineering 101
item.description: I thought I had found a flaw in the great google machine - instead I learned that “libraries are innocent until proven guilty”. I am currently working on an app for Kenyan users, with validation for local phone numbers.

item.title: Android Board Game - Arimaa Free
item.description: Play Store Github Open source contributions welcome! I’m currently looking for someone to pass on the development torch; there’s a lot of interesting work to be done, especially as a beginner/intermediate project.

item.title: Chrome Ext. - Morbid Motivation
item.description: Chrome Store Github The idea is to use our inevitable passing as a source of motivation. Colours are configurable to the user’s tastes.

item.title: Multiplayer Web App - Colorful Conway
item.description: Try it live Github Different clients are given different colours on a standard Game of Life board. The simulation runs as usual - except new cells are generated as an average colour of the cells around it.
